intro: Blaeria spicata subsp. mannii, commonly known as the African daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soil. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy ornamental plant. Its botanical features include hairy stems and alternate leaves, which contribute to its adaptability in diverse environments.
